Interface IChunkLocation

public interface IChunkLocation
Immutable identifier for a Minecraft chunk within a specific world.

IChunkLocation uniquely addresses a chunk using three components: the name of the world it resides in, its X coordinate, and its Z coordinate — all expressed in chunk units, not block units. Two IChunkLocation instances with identical world, X, and Z values refer to the same chunk.

Coordinate system

Minecraft divides each world into 16×16-block columns called chunks. The chunk at chunk-coordinates (cx, cz) covers blocks (cx * 16) through (cx * 16 + 15) on the X axis, and (cz * 16) through (cz * 16 + 15) on the Z axis. To convert a block coordinate to a chunk coordinate, perform an arithmetic right-shift by 4 bits (i.e. blockX >> 4).

Usage example

IChunkLocation loc = ...;

// Convert to block coordinates for the north-west corner of the chunk
int blockX = loc.x() * 16;
int blockZ = loc.z() * 16;

System.out.printf("Chunk (%d, %d) in world '%s' starts at block (%d, %d)%n",
        loc.x(), loc.z(), loc.world(), blockX, blockZ);
Since:
1.0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    world()
    Returns the name of the world that contains this chunk.
    int
    x()
    Returns the X coordinate of this chunk in chunk units.
    int
    z()
    Returns the Z coordinate of this chunk in chunk units.

  • Method Details

    • world

      String world()
      Returns the name of the world that contains this chunk.

      The world name matches the folder name of the world on disk and corresponds to the value returned by org.bukkit.World#getName(). It is case-sensitive.

      Returns:
      the non-null, non-blank world name

    • x

      int x()
      Returns the X coordinate of this chunk in chunk units.

      To obtain the X coordinate of the north-west block corner, multiply by 16: int blockX = x() * 16;.

      Returns:
      the chunk X coordinate

    • z

      int z()
      Returns the Z coordinate of this chunk in chunk units.

      To obtain the Z coordinate of the north-west block corner, multiply by 16: int blockZ = z() * 16;.

      Returns:
      the chunk Z coordinate
